tomato.notes: Basil improves flavor and repels flies and mosquitoes. Marigolds repel nematodes. Carrots loosen soil around roots.

pepper.notes: Basil repels aphids and spider mites. Marigolds deter many common pests. Tomatoes provide beneficial shade.

basil.notes: Improves flavor and growth of tomatoes and peppers. Repels flies, mosquitoes, and thrips.

cucumber.notes: Sunflowers and corn provide trellis support. Radishes deter cucumber beetles. Beans fix nitrogen.

squash.notes: Classic Three Sisters planting with corn and beans. Borage attracts pollinators. Marigolds repel squash bugs.

zucchini.notes: Nasturtiums serve as trap crop for aphids. Radish deters squash vine borers when interplanted.

lettuce.notes: Grows well in shade of taller plants. Radishes mature quickly and make room. Carrots loosen soil.

carrot.notes: Rosemary and sage repel carrot fly. Onions and leeks mask carrot scent from pests. Tomatoes provide shade.

onion.notes: Strong scent deters many pests including carrot fly and aphids. Chamomile improves flavor.

garlic.notes: Natural fungicide and pest deterrent. Repels aphids, Japanese beetles, and spider mites.

beans.notes: Fix nitrogen in soil benefiting neighboring plants. Classic Three Sisters companion with corn and squash.

peas.notes: Fix nitrogen in soil. Grow well on trellises with cucumbers. Cool-season crop pairs well with radishes.

corn.notes: Provides natural trellis for beans and support for vining crops. Three Sisters planting is highly productive.

potato.notes: Horseradish deters potato beetles. Beans fix nitrogen. Keep away from tomato family to prevent blight spread.

broccoli.notes: Aromatic herbs repel cabbage moths. Celery deters white butterflies. Marigolds repel nematodes.

cabbage.notes: Strong herbs mask cabbage scent from pests. Celery repels white cabbage butterfly. Dill attracts beneficial wasps.

cauliflower.notes: Same companion preferences as cabbage family. Benefits from shade during hot weather from taller neighbors.

kale.notes: Hardy brassica that benefits from aromatic herb companions. Lettuce uses shade under kale leaves.

spinach.notes: Cool-season crop that grows well in shade of taller plants. Strawberries and spinach benefit each other.

radish.notes: Fast-growing trap crop for flea beetles. Loosens soil for root vegetables planted later. Marks slow-germinating rows.

beet.notes: Beet greens add minerals to soil. Grows well with brassicas. Onions and garlic deter pests.

celery.notes: Strong scent repels white cabbage butterfly. Benefits from shade of taller crops in hot weather.

eggplant.notes: Nightshade family member. Benefits from nitrogen-fixing beans. Aromatic herbs deter flea beetles.

okra.notes: Heat-loving crop. Provides shade for lettuce. Attracts pollinators with its flowers.

watermelon.notes: Needs space to sprawl. Corn provides windbreak. Marigolds deter beetles and nematodes.

cantaloupe.notes: Similar needs to watermelon. Radishes deter melon pests. Lettuce serves as living mulch.

pumpkin.notes: Three Sisters planting works well. Large leaves shade out weeds. Needs ample space.

strawberry.notes: Borage attracts pollinators and improves flavor. Thyme repels worms. Garlic deters pests.

blueberry.notes: Requires acidic soil (pH 4.5-5.5). Mulch with pine needles. Avoid nightshade family nearby.

raspberry.notes: Garlic deters Japanese beetles. Keep away from nightshades to prevent verticillium wilt. Space from blackberries.

rosemary.notes: Repels cabbage moth, carrot fly, and bean beetles. Drought tolerant, plant on edges of beds.

thyme.notes: Repels cabbage worms and whiteflies. Attracts beneficial insects. Groundcover suppresses weeds.

sage.notes: Repels cabbage moth and carrot fly. Attracts pollinators when flowering. Improves flavor of nearby herbs.

oregano.notes: General pest repellent. Attracts beneficial insects. Hardy groundcover in herb gardens.

mint.notes: Repels aphids, flea beetles, and ants. WARNING: Extremely invasive - always grow in containers.

dill.notes: Attracts beneficial wasps and hoverflies. Young dill helps cucumbers; mature dill may inhibit them.

cilantro.notes: Attracts beneficial insects including hoverflies and parasitic wasps. Bolts in heat, plant successionally.

parsley.notes: Attracts hoverflies that eat aphids. Host plant for swallowtail butterflies. Improves tomato vigor.

sunflower.notes: Attracts pollinators and beneficial insects. Tall varieties provide windbreak and shade. Can serve as trellis.

marigold.notes: Repels nematodes, whiteflies, and many garden pests. French marigolds are most effective. Plant throughout garden.
